title: CPC starts unloading fuel after payment
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) said that the unloading of 37,000 MT of petrol from a tanker that reached Sri Lanka will commence on Friday (20), after payments were made for the shipment.
The Chairman of the CPC told that the unloading of petrol from a ship ordered by the IOC commenced last night.
He further said that the distribution of fuel will be commence as soon as possible.
Meanwhile, the unloading of diesel from a vessel that has arrived at the Colombo Port has concluded.
The Chairman also said that the distribution of diesel will continue.
IMF says Sri Lanka talks conclude May 24, monitoring developments closely
